question: Maximum demographic gap seen in
exp: Max demographic gap is in "late stage 2" Min demographic gap is in "Stage 1" & "Stage 4" Contraction of staing demographic gap is in "early pa of stage-3" Negative demographic gap is seen in "stage-5"
topic_name: Preventive Medicine in Obstetrics, Paediatrics & Geriatrics

question: Couple protection rate should be _____ to achieve Net Reproduction rate 1
exp: Couple protection rate - is an indicator of prevalence of contraceptive practice in a community NRR = 1 can be achieved if CPR > 60% CPR (India): 54%
topic_name: Preventive Medicine in Obstetrics, Paediatrics & Geriatrics

question: Phase 3 is
exp: Demographic cycle based on CBR & CDR Demographic cycle CBR CDR 1st stage High stationary High High 2nd stage Early expanding High Sta decreasing 3rd stage Late expanding Sta decreasing Already decreasing 4th stage Low stationary Low Low 5th stage Decline CDR > CBR
topic_name: Preventive Medicine in Obstetrics, Paediatrics & Geriatrics

question: Under NRHM, post-natal visits are conducted by ASHA as Home Based Newborn Care. In case of institutional delivery, these visits should be conducted by ASHA on days
exp: Under NRHM, postnatal visits by ASHA are done k/a HBNC (Home based New-born care) 6-7 visits are done 6 visits in case of institutional delivery on day 3, 7, 14, 21, 28, 42 7 visits in case of home delivery on day 1, 3, 7, 14, 21, 28, 42
topic_name: Preventive Medicine in Obstetrics, Paediatrics & Geriatrics

question: Average no. of girls that would be born to a woman if she experiences the current feility pattern throughout her reproductive span (15-44 or 49 years), assuming no moality known as
exp: Term Definition Net reproduction rate No. of daughters a newborn girl will bear during her life time assuming fixed age specific feility and moality ratio Gross reproduction rate Average no. of girls that would be born to a woman if she experiences the current feility pattern throughout her reproductive span (15-44 or 49 years), assuming no moality Total marital feility rate Average no. of children that would be born to a married woman if she experiences the current feility pattern throughout her reproductive spam Total feility rate Average no. of children a woman would have if she were to pass through her reproductive bearing children at the same rates as the women now in each age group
topic_name: Preventive Medicine in Obstetrics, Paediatrics & Geriatrics
